description.narrative: The development objective of the Climate-smart Agriculture Support Project for Niger to enhance adaptation to climate risks, to improve agricultural productivity among the Targeted Communities and in the event of an eligible crisis or emergency, to provide immediate and effective response to said eligible crisis or emergency. The project is organized into four components. 1)Investments for scaling up climate-smart agriculture (CSA) are to provide financing to scale up proven technologies and practices, both at commune and individual level, leading to increased agricultural productivity and income while building resilience to climate change in the project area and reducing or removing carbon emissions. This component comprises two subcomponents: i) financing CSA-integrated subprojects at the commune level and ii) inclusive enterprise development for sustainability of CSA; 2) Innovative practices and improved service delivery for mainstreaming CSA is to support the financial investments in Component 1 and adopt innovative practices to achieve the triple outcomes of CSA, farmers capacity needs to be strengthened and they will need access to a number of services from private and public institutions. This component will focus on improving service delivery by national and local institutions and farmers adoption of innovative practices. It will also focus on public sector institutions to improve the policy and enabling environment and facilitate delivery of relevant services by national and local public sector institutions. In addition, this component will work directly with the private sector and attempt to develop market mechanisms for sustained service delivery during and after the project. This component contains three subcomponents: i) Technology transfer, ii) Improved access to information and iii) Support to national institutions for improved service delivery, polic

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Accounting software | Description :The recipient shall acquire and install, and thereafter maintain through theProject implementation, accounting software acceptable to the Association not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date.| Due Date :26-Dec-2016

Finance Agreement :External auditor | Description :The recipient shall recruit an external auditor whose qualifications, experienceand terms of reference shall be acceptable to the Association, not later than six (6) months after Effective. | Due Date:31-Mar-2017

title.narrative: Percentage of procurement activities executed in conformity with the procurement plan, the implementation manual, and IDA procedures
Number of annual audit reports submitted on time with no major qualifications
Time taken to make funds available as requested by GoN for an eligible crisis or emergency
Percentage of targeted commune that have constructed pastoral infrastructure to support CSA
Percentage of Commune whose approved sub-projects integrate gender equity
Percentage of management reports (M&E, safeguards, procurement, FM) presented within 45 days of the end of the relevant period
Number of farmers field school implemented
Percentage of farmers using climate information for agricultural production
Number of vulnerable farmers receiving subsidies from the e-voucher agricultural input subsidy platform
Number of communes that have developed Integrated Climate-Smart Investment Plans
Number of communal sub-projected granted with environmental and social management plan that have been implemented
Number of commune officials and technical staff trained
Percentage of farmers receiving agricultural information through community rural radios
Land area where sustainable land mgt. practices were adopted as a result of proj
Area provided with irrigation and drainage services
Targeted Beneficiaries are satisfied with specific project interventions (e.g. improved service delivery, farmer field school, trainings etc.) ,
A remote sensing, application for monitoring crop performance is established and operational
A national M&E system is established and operational
An e-voucher agricultural input subsidy platform is established and operational
Grievance Redress Mechanism established and operational
Reduced net GHG emissions per unit of food (energy and protein equivalent )
Agricultural productivity increase in the project's areas
Increased adoption of new agricultural and management practices promoted by the project
